channel.title: Comments on: On GPS Accuracy with the Tripmate
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: Kevin Holzer
item.dc:creator: Kevin Holzer
item.description: Most GPS devices use amplified antennas. I bought a module from Trimble that included an antenna with an LNA (low noise amplifier) and a five or ten foot cable. Sparkfun Electronics (www.sparkfun.com) has GPS antennas that have integrated LNA's in them, and the whole shebang hanging off of a cable. You've gotta have an LNA for GPS, as the satellites are broadcasting at quite low signal level.
item.content:encoded: Most GPS devices use amplified antennas. I bought a module from Trimble that included an antenna with an LNA (low noise amplifier) and a five or ten foot cable. Sparkfun Electronics (www.sparkfun.com) has GPS antennas that have integrated LNA’s in them, and the whole shebang hanging off of a cable. You’ve gotta have an LNA for GPS, as the satellites are broadcasting at quite low signal level.

item.title: By: Rodrigo
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo
item.description: Hi, great project..!!, maybe you should get a new GPS receiver, I've worked with the Garmin GPS 18 PC oem and it's accuracy is really nice for the google earth, the route is always good, over the streets, and it doesn't neccesary needs sky view, it can get fixed position in my bedroom .
item.content:encoded: Hi, great project..!!, maybe you should get a new GPS receiver, I’ve worked with the Garmin GPS 18 PC oem and it’s accuracy is really nice for the google earth, the route is always good, over the streets, and it doesn’t neccesary needs sky view, it can get fixed position in my bedroom .
